title: 'rustc' panicked at 'internal error: entered unreachable code', src/libsyntax/ast.rs:668:6  while bootstrapping

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: T-bootstrap
labels.description: Relevant to the bootstrap subteam: Rust's build system (x.py and src/bootstrap)

body:
git checkout 02f5786a324c40b2d8b2d0df98456e48fb45d30c
./x.py build
git checkout f492693982d1e252f5411ae3e4d560ab0dfea48a
./x.py build
=> ICE'd

<details>
<summary> Click for build log and stack trace </summary>

````

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

error: Could not compile `syn`.
warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
error: build failed
command did not execute successfully: "/home/matthias/vcs/github/rust/build/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage0/bin/cargo" "build" "--target" "x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu" "-j" "4" "--release" "--features" "" "--manifest-path" "/home/matthias/vcs/github/rust/src/rustc/Cargo.toml" "--message-format" "json"
expected success, got: exit code: 101
failed to run: /home/matthias/vcs/github/rust/build/bootstrap/debug/bootstrap build
Build completed unsuccessfully in 0:00:15
````

</details>


config.toml:
````toml
[llvm]
[build]
submodules = true
extended = true
tools = ["cargo", "rls", "clippy", "rustfmt", "analysis", "src"]
sanitizers = true
profiler = true
low-priority = true
[install]
[rust]
[target.x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu]
[dist]
````
